intro: Uncifera obtusifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved marsh plant, is a herbaceous perennial native to wetland and swampy areas. It features broad, ovate leaves with a rounded base and a slightly hairy surface. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in spikes, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its root system is fibrous and adapted for waterlogged soils, aiding in nutrient absorption. Uncifera obtusifolia plays a vital role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems and providing habitat for aquatic insects.
